For things that are placed** most remotely from us, as likewise those which yield no opportunity of adjusting our opinion of them by** experience, such, it is universally known, are most"apt to excite admiration. Reflect, ye citizens of A-"thens, that your present elevation of spirits is owing"to your success against the Laced monians and allies.** You crouched for fear under their first attacks; till,"having gained the superiority over them, to their utter"disappointment, you instantly despised them. And"now, nothing less than Sicily can content you.
